title: British English Phrasal Verbs - Complete Database

take_off.meaning: to leave the ground (plane); to remove clothing; to become successful suddenly

take_up.meaning: to start a hobby or activity; to occupy space or time; to accept an offer

take_on.meaning: to accept responsibility or work; to employ; to compete against

take_over.meaning: to gain control; to replace someone in a position

take_after.meaning: to resemble a family member in appearance or character

take_back.meaning: to retract a statement; to return something; to remind of the past

take_out.meaning: to remove; to invite someone to a restaurant or event; to obtain officially

take_in.meaning: to provide shelter; to deceive; to understand; to make clothing smaller

take_away.meaning: to remove; to subtract; to arrest; food bought to eat elsewhere

take_down.meaning: to write down; to remove from a high place; to dismantle

go_on.meaning: to continue; to happen; to proceed

go_out.meaning: to leave home for entertainment; to stop burning; to be in a relationship

go_off.meaning: to explode; to sound (alarm); to become bad (food); to leave

go_through.meaning: to examine carefully; to experience something difficult; to be approved

go_over.meaning: to review; to examine; to be received in a particular way

go_up.meaning: to increase; to be built; to explode

go_back.meaning: to return; to have known someone for a long time; to break a promise

go_ahead.meaning: to proceed; to take place; to do something despite difficulties

go_down.meaning: to decrease; to sink; to be remembered; to be received

go_away.meaning: to leave; to disappear; to go on holiday

look_after.meaning: to take care of; to be responsible for

look_out.meaning: to be careful; to watch for danger

look_up.meaning: to search for information; to improve; to visit someone

look_down_on.meaning: to regard as inferior; to despise

look_back.meaning: to think about the past; to remember

get_up.meaning: to rise from bed; to stand up

get_on.meaning: to board; to progress; to have a good relationship

get_off.meaning: to leave transport; to escape punishment; to finish work

get_through.meaning: to complete; to survive; to make contact by phone

get_away.meaning: to escape; to go on holiday

get_by.meaning: to manage with difficulty; to survive financially

get_along.meaning: to have a good relationship; to manage; to progress

get_down.meaning: to depress; to descend; to write down

keep_up.meaning: to continue at the same rate; to maintain; to prevent from sleeping

keep_on.meaning: to continue; to persist; to retain in employment

keep_off.meaning: to avoid; to stay away from

keep_away.meaning: to stay at a distance; to prevent from approaching

keep_back.meaning: to restrain; to withhold; to maintain distance

keep_out.meaning: to remain outside; to prevent from entering

keep_to.meaning: to adhere to; to limit oneself to

keep_down.meaning: to control; to maintain at a low level; to retain food in stomach

keep_in.meaning: to confine; to remain indoors; to maintain contact

put_off.meaning: to postpone; to discourage; to cause dislike

put_on.meaning: to wear; to stage a performance; to gain weight; to pretend

put_up.meaning: to provide accommodation; to erect; to display; to increase

put_away.meaning: to store; to imprison; to consume food/drink

put_down.meaning: to place on a surface; to criticize; to kill an animal; to write down

put_out.meaning: to extinguish; to inconvenience; to publish; to annoy

put_back.meaning: to return to original position; to postpone

put_forward.meaning: to propose; to suggest; to advance time

put_through.meaning: to connect by phone; to cause to experience something difficult

turn_on.meaning: to activate; to attack; to depend on; to excite

turn_off.meaning: to deactivate; to leave a road; to repel

turn_up.meaning: to arrive; to increase volume; to appear unexpectedly; to discover

turn_down.meaning: to reject; to decrease volume; to fold down

turn_out.meaning: to result; to attend; to produce; to expel

turn_over.meaning: to flip; to transfer; to think carefully; to do business worth

turn_away.meaning: to refuse entry; to look in another direction

turn_around.meaning: to rotate; to reverse direction; to improve a situation

run_into.meaning: to meet by chance; to collide with; to encounter problems

run_out_of.meaning: to use all of something; to have no more

run_over.meaning: to hit with a vehicle; to exceed time limit; to review quickly

come_across.meaning: to find by chance; to seem; to make an impression

come_up_with.meaning: to think of; to produce an idea or solution

bring_up.meaning: to raise a child; to mention a topic; to vomit

break_down.meaning: to stop functioning; to lose emotional control; to analyze; to demolish

break_up.meaning: to end a relationship; to separate into pieces; to stop fighting

carry_out.meaning: to perform; to execute; to fulfill

carry_on.meaning: to continue; to behave in an excited way

work_out.meaning: to exercise; to solve; to develop successfully; to calculate

point_out.meaning: to indicate; to draw attention to

fill_in.meaning: to complete a form; to substitute; to inform

give_up.meaning: to stop trying; to quit; to surrender

pick_up.meaning: to lift; to collect; to learn informally; to improve; to answer phone

drop_off.meaning: to deliver; to fall asleep; to decrease

hold_on.meaning: to wait; to grip tightly; to endure

set_up.meaning: to establish; to arrange; to assemble; to frame someone

deal_with.meaning: to handle; to manage; to be about

catch_up_with.meaning: to reach the same level; to meet and talk; to finally punish

sentences.text: The plane will _____ at 3pm from Heathrow airport.
I've decided to _____ tennis as a hobby this year.
She _____ a lot of responsibility in her new job.
The new manager will _____ from Mr. Smith next month.
He _____ his father - they look almost identical.
I'd like to _____ what I said earlier - I was wrong.
Let me _____ you for dinner to celebrate your promotion.
The refugees were _____ by local families during the crisis.
The police _____ the suspect for questioning yesterday.
Please _____ these important points in your notebook.
The meeting _____ for three hours without a break.
Would you like to _____ for dinner this weekend?
The bomb could _____ at any moment according to experts.
Let's _____ the plan one more time before the presentation.
Can you _____ my essay and check for grammar mistakes?
House prices have _____ significantly in the last year.
We can't _____ on our promise to help them move house.
Despite the difficulties, we decided to _____ with the project.
The Titanic _____ after hitting an iceberg in 1912.
I wish this headache would _____ - I've had it all day.
Can you _____ my cat while I'm on holiday next week?
I've been _____ my keys everywhere but can't find them.
We're really _____ the summer holidays this year.
Police are _____ the cause of the mysterious fire.
_____! There's a car coming towards you very fast!
If you don't know a word, _____ it in the dictionary.
She tends to _____ people who didn't go to university.
Young children often _____ their older siblings and copy them.
Can you _____ my homework before I hand it in tomorrow?
When I _____ on my childhood, I realize how happy I was.
I always _____ at 6:30am to go jogging before breakfast.
How are you _____ with your new course at university?
Please _____ the bus at the next stop near the hospital.
It took me weeks to _____ the flu I caught last month.
How will we _____ all this work before the deadline?
The thieves managed to _____ before the police arrived.
What time did you _____ from your trip to London yesterday?
We don't earn much but we manage to _____ somehow.
I _____ really well with my new flatmates - we're good friends.
Don't let exam stress _____ you - just do your best.
Well done! _____ the good work and you'll pass the exam.
The rain _____ falling all day without stopping once.
_____ the grass! There's a sign saying not to walk on it.
Try to _____ from junk food if you want to lose weight.
The police _____ the crowds while the President's car passed.
Please _____ of the kitchen while I'm cooking dinner.
You must _____ your promise to help with the school concert.
The doctor advised him to _____ his cholesterol levels.
They decided to _____ the news until after the wedding.
She _____ me for hours with her endless complaints and stories.
Don't _____ until tomorrow what you can do today - start now!
_____ your coat - it's freezing outside this morning.
We can _____ you for the night if you miss your train home.
Please _____ your toys when you've finished playing with them.
The teacher had to _____ the phone during the lesson.
Firefighters managed to _____ the blaze before it spread.
Can you _____ the meeting for an hour? I'm running late.
She _____ an interesting idea at the conference yesterday.
Could you _____ me to the manager, please? It's urgent.
I don't know how she _____ his rude behavior for so long.
Can you _____ the lights when you come in? It's dark.
Don't forget to _____ your computer before you leave work.
Could you _____ the volume? I can't hear the TV properly.
Please _____ the music - the neighbors are complaining again!
Over 500 people _____ for the auditions for the school play.
Water _____ ice when the temperature drops below zero.
Remember to _____ your exam paper when the time is up.
It's too late to _____ now - we're already committed to the plan.
The hotel had to _____ guests because they were fully booked.
_____ and face me when I'm talking to you!
I _____ an old friend from school at the shopping center yesterday.
While researching, I _____ some fascinating information about Vikings.
She didn't want to _____ the subject during dinner with guests.
My car _____ on the motorway and I had to call for help.
They're planning to _____ a new business in the city center.
Scientists will _____ experiments to test the new drug's safety.
I need to _____ at the gym more regularly to stay fit.
Can you help me _____ this math problem? I'm completely stuck.
The teacher _____ several mistakes in my essay that I'd missed.
Please _____ this application form and return it by Friday.
They had to _____ the football match because of heavy rain.
Don't _____ trying - you can learn anything if you practice enough!
Can you _____ some milk from the shop on your way home?
I'll _____ you at the station at 8am tomorrow morning.
My sister will _____ the children while we're at the concert.
Despite the interruption, the teacher _____ with the lesson.
_____ a minute - I'm not ready to leave yet!
She _____ the job offer because the salary was too low.
What time will you _____ from your trip to Paris tomorrow?
This pain won't _____ - I think I need to see a doctor.
The new policies will _____ significant changes in education.
We need to _____ a solution to this problem by tomorrow.
Teachers have to _____ difficult situations every day at school.
I _____ all my classmates - we're a very friendly group.
How can I _____ missing your birthday party last week?
I can't _____ his constant complaining about everything anymore!
We've _____ coffee - could you buy some on your way home?
I need to _____ my friends - I've been away for months.
She tends to _____ people from different social backgrounds.
Doctors advise people to _____ sugar and salt in their diet.
